definition: to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to

sentences.english: But imagine the transition for a sadist.
sentences.chinese: 但是，请想像一个虐待狂的过渡。

sentences.english: His dotage simply made him more sadistic.
sentences.chinese: 再加上年老糊涂，他就更是个虐待狂了。

sentences.english: As for the sadist this identification only appears on the stage.
sentences.chinese: 至于虐待狂，这个认同只是出现在舞台上。

sentences.english: If he says that this game is going to be sadistic, he probably means it.
sentences.chinese: 如果他说，这场比赛将是虐待狂，他很可能意味着它。

sentences.english: In prison there are sadistic wardens.
sentences.chinese: 在监狱有虐待狂督导员。

sentences.english: In this sense, sadism is merely the disavowal of masochism.
sentences.chinese: 以这个意义来说，虐待狂仅仅是受虐狂的不被承认。

sentences.english: In prison, there are wardens who are often sadistic. At work, they are called managers.
sentences.chinese: 监狱里狱卒常常是虐待狂，在办公室他们被叫作经理。

sentences.english: Thinking back, that friend might have been some sort of sadist.
sentences.chinese: 现在回想起来，我那个朋友可能有点虐待狂的倾向。

sentences.english: It's an exercise in sadistic conversational gamesmanship.
sentences.chinese: 这是虐待狂式交谈伎俩的一次小演习。

sentences.english: There was a sadistic streak in him.

definition: to torment/to abuse (an animal, child etc)
